thread.title: Indianapolis Christmas forecast warm weather reaching record highs
thread.title_full: Indianapolis Christmas forecast warm weather reaching record highs

author: Alysa Guffey
title: Indianapolis Christmas forecast warm weather reaching record highs
text:
Will 2025 be the warmest Christmas in Indianapolis ever? 'We're in record territory'
Alysa Guffey
Indianapolis is expected to have a warm holiday week, with temperatures on Christmas Day reaching potential record highs.
The National Weather Service is predicting a high of 64 degrees in Indianapolis this coming Thursday, which would tie a record high temperature set in 1893 for the warmest Christmas Day on record since the NWS began recording data in 1871.
Since 1871, the high temperature on Dec. 25 has been over 60 degrees just five times. Two of those days have come in the past five years.
"We're in record territory," NWS Indianapolis meteorologist Cody Moore told IndyStar. "We came really close in 2021 with a high of 63 degrees, and then 62 degrees in 2019, so it's not too uncommon that it's been this warm in recent years."
Indianapolis can expect warm weather throughout the week and virtually no chance for a white, snowy holiday week.
The travel forecast is looking "pretty good" through Christmas and New Year's Eve, albeit there's a slight chance of rain on the morning of Dec. 25, Moore said. But he cautioned that travelers should still check the forecast before heading out.
